intro: Notholaena ochracea, commonly known as the ochre bottlebrush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, dense clusters of bright orange-red flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub with woody stems and narrow, linear leaves. Its unique floral structure attracts various pollinators, including birds and insects. Notholaena ochracea is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its striking appearance.
